name: Oops Bar and Restaurant

reviews.text: This is a gem of a place. Cottages are native style and I guess basic, but the owner has made nice touches like air fresheners in rooms and bathrooms. Very clean rooms and good modern fans. There was no hot water, not that you'd need it. Bottled water is provided in the room and a water cooler outside to top up when you require. Gorgeous little balcony with seat outside and space to dry your clothes. Just off the beach. Food in the restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced. The bar also runs happy hour promotions at different times on different drinks. Staff are fantastic and can organise day trips, transfers etc. they even organised someone to come and cut my hair for a very reasonable price! The bar is quite lively, but you will not be disturbed in your rooms. Nice and peaceful and set in little gardens with 24hr security. Really friendly, fun place to stay. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: No Oops about booking here, great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel- because so far this is the cheapest and internet accessible Inn along Alona Beach. Their website is informative and gives you correct info and pics of their property.
reviews.title: Good- but can be BETTER

reviews.text: All 8 FAN rooms are made of native/indigenous materials. Rooms are located behind the bar but its STILL quiet and peaceful during night.
reviews.title: Amazing place - loved the food! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I don't like about their rooms is first the floor- its not polished- and its a little sandy and muddy. It's seems like they assumed that everyone who will stay in cottage will bring their slippers full of sands inside the room- not on our case- we'd like as much as possible our room to be clean- comfortable to sleep in. They can at least give 2 sets of complimentary house slippers that guests can use inside the room only.
